abstracts.cdata!:
The project''''s
            outcome is rated as unsatisfactory since its major
            objectives were not fully achieved. Key lessons learned
            include: 1) Stable sector management is a necessary
            condition for project success. 2) The assignment of local
            financing obligations for capital works to a utility should
            be informed by the utility''''s proven
            capability and not on projected performance. 3) In terms of
            project design, a positive innovation of the project was the
            successful establishment and implementation of a
            clearinghouse arrangement to settle
            Government''''s current liabilities to
            Ghana Water and Sewerage Corporation (GWSC). 4) It is only
            by adequate customer identification and holistic packaging
            that measurable results can be attained. 5) The Project and
            Construction Management Unit structure functioned as planned
            but had limited use and could not be easily integrated into
            GWSC. 6) More innovative contracting methods are needed for
            rehabilitation works on plants that must remain operational.
            7) Reduction of unaccounted for water is a process involving
            significant works components as well as improved commercial
            management in addition to measures to stop commercial leaks.
